Developing Your Own Components

There is no one correct way to develop software. This page will describe one way which we found convenient. It uses CMake and closely follows the setup used for building Orca components.

Installation and Setup

Download the tar archive. Here's how to customize this thing to a particular "user" (this is also described in empty-components/README file): After each change, simply run 'cmake .; make' to compile.

  1. Rename
    1. pick a name. here it will be referred as 'user', but it could be a project, or whatever..
    2. rename dir to user-components.
    3. replace 'empty-components' with 'user-components' in lines 1, 5 and 6 in file "user-components"/CMakeLists.txt
  2. To add a component
    1. add a component dir in "user-components"/src/components/
    2. uncomment SUBDIRS block in src/components/CMakeLists.txt and add the name of your component.
    3. To add an object
      1. add object files in "user-components"/src/objects/
      2. uncomment 'objects' in src/CMakeLists.txt
      3. replace 'EmptyObjects' with 'UserObjects' in lines 9 and 11 in file src/objects/orca/CMakeLists.txt. This will be the name of the library where all your object code will reside.
    4. Maintanence
      1. Periodically, replace all files in "user-components"/config with the corresponding files from "orca-components".

    Compiling

    Run 'cmake' at the top level as you do in orca-components. Then run 'make' and 'make install' at any level in the directory tree. Things to remember:

    • All component executables are installed in /usr/local/bin (same place as the standard Orca components.)
    • All XML files are installed in /usr/local/share/orca/ (same place as the standard Orca XML files.)
